description: Number of prime palindromes with 2n+1 digits.
links: Shyam Sunder Gupta, Palindromic Primes up to 10^19.
Shyam Sunder Gupta, Palindromic Primes up to 10^21.
Shyam Sunder Gupta, Palindromic Primes up to 10^23.
example: a(1)=15 because Number of prime palindromes with 3 digits is 15. [_Shyam Sunder Gupta_, Mar 14 2009]
prog: (PARI) a(n) = {my(nb = 0); forprime(p=10^(2*n), 10^(2*n+1)-1, if (eval(concat(Vecrev(Str(p)))) == p, nb++);); nb;} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jul 24 2015
crossrefs: Subsequence of A016115, which is the main entry.
author: _Patrick De Geest_
